page.title: 02GLADDERBROOK,HEIGHTINGTON
page.content: Gladder Brook is a nice place to go fishing and have picnics. The word "Gladder" comes from the Anglo-Saxon ,meaning "clear." Some birds to be seen in the area are pheasant, goldfinch,partridge and woodpecker. The wild animals we have observed are fox,badger,rabbit,mink,shrew,mole and red and grey squirrel. There are lots of wild flowers and insects.In the brook are trout and eels. The brook flows through Ribbesford Woods on its way to the River Severn at Stourport. The bottom of the brook is sandy and rocky. I have spent many happy times by the Gladder Brook.
